The provided code chunk is situated within a larger function or method responsible for managing and disabling specific transformation handles in a 3D manipulation system. This function uses conditional statements (`elif`) to determine which handles to disable based on the type of transformation selected (e.g., translation, rotation, scaling). The chunk specifically addresses cases where all handles are disabled when `handles` is set to 'scale' or 'all', ensuring that only relevant controls remain active during these operations.

elif handles == 'scale':
            self.disableHandles(['x-scale','y-scale','z-scale'])
        elif handles == 'all':
            self.disableHandles(['x-post','x-ring','x-disc','x-scale',
                                 'y-post','y-ring','y-disc','y-scale',
                                 'z-post','z-ring','z-disc','z-scale'])
